qas.question: Which Carnival is held in Germany's west?
Cologne Carnival is one of the largest Carnivals and also is the most what?
What is colloquially known as Old Women Day?
What are the women who stormy city halls allowed to do to any passing man?

context: <a0_0>The "Rheinische"<a0_0/> Carnival is held in the west of Germany, mainly in the states of North Rhine-Westphalia or Nordrhein-Westfalen, Rhineland Palatinate or Rheinland-Pfalz, but also in Hessen [including Oberhessen], Bavaria and other states. Some cities are more famous for celebrations such as parades and costume balls. Köln or Cologne Carnival, as well as Mainz and Düsseldorf are the largest and most <a1_0>famous<a1_0/>. Other cities have their own, often less well-known celebrations, parades and parties such as Worms am Rhein, Speyer, Kaiserslautern, Frankfurt, Darmstadt, Mannheim, Ludwigshafen, Stuttgart, Augsburg and München [Munich] <a2_0>Nürnberg. On Carnival Thursday<a2_0/> (called "Old Women Day" or "The Women's Day") in commemoration of an 1824 revolt by <a3_0>washer-women<a3_0/>, women storm city halls, cut men's ties, and are allowed to <a4_0>kiss<a4_0/> any passing man.
